intro: Halenia dombeyana var. patens, commonly known as the spreading halenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
